page.title: 11Transport (part 2)
page.content: This canal runs from Worsley near Manchester to connect with the Potteries. We spent 3 hours by the canal and only saw 5 pleasure boats. Ther were plenty of signs of wildlife and a lot of fishermen. The canal towpath is also well used by people exercising. There were more walkers than cruisers. The main London- Scotland railway runs North-South here, at peak periods one train will pass every 7 minutes. The level crossing and its signal box have been abandoned, it means quite a long detour to cross the lines by car. There is a large marina close to the intersection of the motorway, railway and canal. A housing development overlooks the canal, properties starting at about Â£21,000 for a typical property with 3 bedrooms, kitchen,lounge and balcony.
